page.title: 10W.E.A. IN RISELEY
page.content: The Workers Educational Association was founded in 1903 with the aim of interesting men and women in their continued education. It is a democratic voluntary organisation,has no political ties and is a registered charity. The Riseley branch of the W.E.A. has been in existance for less than a year and is part of Sharnbrook and District W.E.A. The Riseley branch meets in the village hall on wednesday mornings and holds informal meetings over a cup of coffee. Creche facilities are available so parents with young children can come along. Courses held include "Women in Literature","Local Country Houses","Archaeology of the Ouse Valley" and "Current Affairs".
